hints.label: def-ig-bipartition
hints.title: Spatial Bipartition of IG
hints.content:
128: :label: def-ig-bipartition
129: 
130: Let $A \subset \mathcal{X}$ be a spatial region with boundary $\partial A$ (the horizon $H$).
131: 
132: **Partition walkers** by position:
133: - $A$-walkers: Those with $x_i \in A$
134: - $A^c$-walkers: Those with $x_i \in A^c = \mathcal{X} \setminus A$
135: 
136: For a state $|N; x_1, v_1, \ldots, x_N, v_N\rangle$, let:
137: - $N_A = |\{i : x_i \in A\}|$ (number in $A$)
138: - $N_{A^c} = N - N_A$ (number in $A^c$)
139: 
140: **Hilbert space factorization**:
141: 
142: $$
143: \mathcal{H}_N \cong \bigoplus_{N_A=0}^N \mathcal{H}_{N_A}^A \otimes \mathcal{H}_{N - N_A}^{A^c}
144: $$
145: 
146: where:
147: - $\mathcal{H}_{N_A}^A = L^2(A^{N_A} \times \mathcal{V}^{N_A}) / S_{N_A}$
148: - $\mathcal{H}_{N_{A^c}}^{A^c} = L^2((A^c)^{N_{A^c}} \times \mathcal{V}^{N_{A^c}}) / S_{N_{A^c}}$
149: 
150: **Full Fock space factorization**:
151: 
152: $$
153: \mathcal{H}_{\text{IG}} \cong \mathcal{H}_A \otimes \mathcal{H}_{A^c}
154: $$
155: 
156: where:
157: 
158: $$

125: **Goal**: Factorize $\mathcal{H}_{\text{IG}}$ into region $A$ and complement $A^c$.
126: 
127: :::{prf:definition} Spatial Bipartition of IG
128: :label: def-ig-bipartition
129: 
130: Let $A \subset \mathcal{X}$ be a spatial region with boundary $\partial A$ (the horizon $H$).
131: 
132: **Partition walkers** by position:
133: - $A$-walkers: Those with $x_i \in A$
134: - $A^c$-walkers: Those with $x_i \in A^c = \mathcal{X} \setminus A$
135: 
136: For a state $|N; x_1, v_1, \ldots, x_N, v_N\rangle$, let:
137: - $N_A = |\{i : x_i \in A\}|$ (number in $A$)
138: - $N_{A^c} = N - N_A$ (number in $A^c$)
139: 
140: **Hilbert space factorization**:
141: 
142: $$
143: \mathcal{H}_N \cong \bigoplus_{N_A=0}^N \mathcal{H}_{N_A}^A \otimes \mathcal{H}_{N - N_A}^{A^c}
144: $$
145: 
146: where:
147: - $\mathcal{H}_{N_A}^A = L^2(A^{N_A} \times \mathcal{V}^{N_A}) / S_{N_A}$
148: - $\mathcal{H}_{N_{A^c}}^{A^c} = L^2((A^c)^{N_{A^c}} \times \mathcal{V}^{N_{A^c}}) / S_{N_{A^c}}$
149: 
150: **Full Fock space factorization**:
151: 
152: $$
153: \mathcal{H}_{\text{IG}} \cong \mathcal{H}_A \otimes \mathcal{H}_{A^c}
154: $$
155: 
156: where:
157: 
158: $$
159: \mathcal{H}_A = \bigoplus_{N_A=0}^\infty \mathcal{H}_{N_A}^A, \quad \mathcal{H}_{A^c} = \bigoplus_{N_{A^c}=0}^\infty \mathcal{H}_{N_{A^c}}^{A^c}

hints.label: lem-jump-hamiltonian-boundary
hints.title: Jump Hamiltonian Localization
hints.content:
170: :label: lem-jump-hamiltonian-boundary
171: 
172: The jump Hamiltonian has the structure:
173: 
174: $$
175: \mathcal{H}_{\text{jump}} = \mathcal{H}_A + \mathcal{H}_{A^c} + \mathcal{H}_{\text{boundary}}
176: $$
177: 
178: where:
179: - $\mathcal{H}_A$: Terms with $x, y \in A$ (internal to $A$)
180: - $\mathcal{H}_{A^c}$: Terms with $x, y \in A^c$ (internal to $A^c$)
181: - $\mathcal{H}_{\text{boundary}}$: Terms with $x \in \partial A, y$ spans bulk (crossing boundary)
hints.raw_directive:
167: **Key observation**: The jump Hamiltonian $\mathcal{H}_{\text{jump}}$ measures correlations precisely at the boundary $\partial A$.
168: 
169: :::{prf:lemma} Jump Hamiltonian Localization
170: :label: lem-jump-hamiltonian-boundary
171: 
172: The jump Hamiltonian has the structure:
173: 
174: $$
175: \mathcal{H}_{\text{jump}} = \mathcal{H}_A + \mathcal{H}_{A^c} + \mathcal{H}_{\text{boundary}}
176: $$
177: 
178: where:
179: - $\mathcal{H}_A$: Terms with $x, y \in A$ (internal to $A$)
180: - $\mathcal{H}_{A^c}$: Terms with $x, y \in A^c$ (internal to $A^c$)
181: - $\mathcal{H}_{\text{boundary}}$: Terms with $x \in \partial A, y$ spans bulk (crossing boundary)
182:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-64
hints.content:
185: 
186: :::{prf:proof}
187: Split the double integral:
188: 
189: $$
190: \mathcal{H}_{\text{jump}} = \int_{\partial A} dx \int_{\mathbb{R}^d} dy \, K_\varepsilon(x, y) \rho(x) \rho(y) F(\Phi(x) - \Phi(y))
191: $$
192: 
193: where $F(z) = e^{z/2} - 1 - z/2$.
194: 
195: Since $x \in \partial A$ (the horizon) and $y$ ranges over all of $\mathbb{R}^d$, the integral naturally splits:
196: - $y \in A$: Correlations from boundary into $A$
197: - $y \in A^c$: Correlations from boundary into $A^c$
198: 
199: For Gaussian kernel, $K_\varepsilon(x, y) \sim \exp(-\|x-y\|^2/(2\varepsilon_c^2))$ decays exponentially, so only terms with $\|x - y\| \lesssim \varepsilon_c$ contribute significantly.
200: 
201: **Boundary dominance**: When $x \in \partial A$ and $\varepsilon_c$ is the correlation length scale, the kernel connects points within distance $\varepsilon_c$ of the boundary, which includes points on both sides of $\partial A$.
